title: Battery - Reconnection

body.body: Positive (+) and Negative (-) battery terminals or leads that come into contact with each other caused by chafing, damage to the cable insulation or trapping may cause a short circuit.
Make sure that the battery terminals do not touch the motorcycle frame and the battery leads are routed correctly.
A short to ground may damage the harness, ignite battery gases, damage to the motorcycle and a risk of personal injury.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first. Tighten the battery terminals to
Apply a light coat of grease to the terminals to prevent corrosion.
Cover the terminals with the protective caps.
If removed secure the positive battery lead to the wire guide in the position shown below.
Once the battery has been reconnected the rider’s configuration settings should be reset as noted prior to the battery being disconnected.

If the battery has been disconnected or the fuses removed for any reason advise the rider to confirm the original mode settings have been correctly set. Failure to reset the motorcycle to the rider’s preferred rider mode settings and subsequently being ridden may cause loss of motorcycle control and an accident.
